title: Potential energy - derive from force function

content.question: One end of an unstretched spring is attached to a wall. When the spring is at its equilibrium length the right end is at position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. A student pulls the right end of the spring until the right end of the spring is at position <math alttext="x equals 2 a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></math>, as shown in the figures. The magnitude of the force exerted by the spring on the student as a function of position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of the right end of the spring is <math alttext="F of x equals, 6 x squared minus 2 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly indicates the change in potential energy of the spring during the time that the free end of the spring moves from <math alttext="x equals a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi></math> to <math alttext="x equals 2 a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 a cubed minus a squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="14 a cubed minus 3 a squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>14</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="42 a cubed minus 6 a squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>42</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="14 a cubed minus 3 a squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>14</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
